noun.name: snowboard
noun.discription: a board resembling a short, broad ski, used for sliding downhill on snow

object1.name: skateboard
object1.discription: in parallel with 'snowboard', is a narrow board with wheels, used for riding and performing tricks on streets and ramps

object2.name: surfboard
object2.discription: in parallel with 'snowboard', is a long, narrow board used in surfing, designed to glide on the surface of the water

object3.name: wakeboard
object3.discription: in parallel with 'snowboard', is a short, wide board used in wakeboarding, designed to be towed behind a boat while riding on water

object4.name: longboard
object4.discription: in parallel with 'snowboard', is a type of skateboard with a longer and wider deck, used for cruising and downhill riding

object5.name: snowmobile
object5.discription: in parallel with 'snowboard', is a vehicle designed for winter travel and recreation on snow, with tracks and skis

object6.name: sled
object6.discription: in parallel with 'snowboard', is a vehicle with a smooth undersurface or set of runners, designed to slide over snow and ice

object7.name: ice skate
object7.discription: in parallel with 'snowboard', is a boot with a metal blade attached to the bottom, used for gliding across ice

object8.name: rollerblade
object8.discription: in parallel with 'snowboard', is a boot with inline skates attached, used for inline skating on various surfaces
